abstract: Why the tax plan is so bad, continued.
snippet: Why the tax plan is so bad, continued.
lead_paragraph: A brief note while waiting for a family member to finish with the doctor: From comments I see that some readers believe that Cain's second "9" is a profits tax, which I've argued in the past probably falls on capital owners. But it isn't: it's a tax on all business income, defined as sales minus purchased inputs and dividends -- but with no deduction for wages. So the new element here is, in effect, a 9 percent tax on wages paid.
